channel.title: Dual monitor on ubuntu
channel.description: I'm using ubuntu and recently my dad bought a new monitor for his new computer. so i got his old one... I'm going to start using dual monitors tomorrow after i buy the cable, how will i go about doing this? anything i need to install?

item.title: Dual monitor on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

It depends if you have a video card with dual outputs. If you just have one video output your pretty much SOL.

Read full topic

item.title: Dual monitor on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=221174

Ubuntu users have possibly the largest amount of help resources available, but they can’t use google to find them apparently.

item.title: Dual monitor on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What kind of graphics card do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Dual monitor on ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:3, topic:315424”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=411859.msg3037170#msg3037170 date=1258844924]
You will probably need to set it up with Xorg, if you have an nVidia card it’s piss easy.
[/quote]
im sorry ive had ubuntu for like 6-7 months now and havent really used it, so how do i get Xorg? can you give me the command?[/quote]
You have Xorg, and it is currently running.
You will need to install and run nvidia-xconfig (assuming you have an nVidia card).

Read full topic
